N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 17.2 - Content of request

State Regulations

The written request for an order of transfer shall state or
include: (a) The reasons for the
request; indicating how the patient will benefit from the transfer. (b) The name and address of the person
requesting the transfer and his relationship to the patient. (c) The name of the facility to which the
transfer is proposed, and the written consent of the director of such facility
to the transfer. (d) The age of the
patient. In the case of a voluntary patient under 18 years of age if the
request for transfer is not made by his parent or legal guardian, the request
shall include the written consent of the parent or guardian unless the patient
was admitted on his own motion in which case his written consent must be
obtained. (e) The legal admission
status of the patient. (1)

If the patient is
voluntary or informal and is not requesting the transfer, the request shall
include his written consent. (2)

If
the patient is involuntary or non-objecting, the proposed transfer shall be
discussed with the patient. No request shall be made by the facility if the
patient objects unless he has had the opportunity to appeal the decision to the
director. The request shall state that the patient does not object or the
result of any appeal. (f) A statement that no court proceedings are
pending involving the patient. Notes
